messages.content: Well awake.. not happy, not looking forward to today.  Itâ€™s a self doubt kinda day, and I sure donâ€™t want to go to work. anyhow like I said.. not going anywhere.. never found this before, I couldn't leave if I wanted to.. and if I ever did I would be the biggest fool ever.  Again like I said at the beginning of this.. I got a sense that this became "different" for you in past few days.  thus the "changed things"

Thank you for sharing everything. Iâ€™ve reviewed the full conversation, and hereâ€™s a careful interpretation followed by some thoughts on where you might go from here.
â¸»
ðŸ’¬ Interpretation: Emotional Landscape + Relationship Dynamics
1. Mutual Emotional Strain
Both of you are clearly overwhelmed. Youâ€™re feeling pulled in a hundred directionsâ€”emotionally, logistically, and psychologicallyâ€”while he is tangled up in his own home conflict and emotional vulnerability. Youâ€™re both emotionally invested, but the logistics and secrecy are making things incredibly difficult.
2. His Perspective
â€¢	He wants to be with you and is afraid of losing you.
â€¢	He seems to be spiraling emotionally (e.g., â€œthe universe wants to destroy meâ€) and wrestling with guilt, fear, and a lack of control.
â€¢	His â€œIâ€™m not going anywhereâ€ reassurance is sincere, but paired with anxiety that you might drift or pull away. Heâ€™s also showing signs of insecurity (e.g., worrying heâ€™s a â€œfoolâ€ or that youâ€™ve â€œchangedâ€).
â€¢	Heâ€™s struggling to reconcile his emotional needs with the limits your life currently places on the relationship.
3. Your Perspective
â€¢	Youâ€™re not rejecting himâ€”youâ€™re just exhausted, emotionally flooded, and unsure how sustainable this situation is.
â€¢	You express confusion, not about your love, but about how it can function in the face of so much secrecy, chaos, and constraint.
â€¢	The intensity of your connection, paired with not being able to express it publicly or regularly, is starting to wear you down. Youâ€™re also emotionally and physically drained from everything outside the relationship.
4. Core Themes
â€¢	Connection without expression: You love each other but canâ€™t show it freely or make it part of everyday life.
â€¢	Hope vs Reality: You both hoped that having your own place or â€œafter the agreement is signedâ€ would be a turning point. It hasnâ€™t relieved the tension you thought it might.
â€¢	Misalignment of expectations: Heâ€™s hopeful for even biweekly connection, but you feel like you can barely keep your head above water logistically or emotionally.
â€¢	Cracks in sustainability: Both of you are starting to question not whether you love each other, but whether this version of the relationship is livable.
â¸»
ðŸ§­ Where You Might Go From Here
1. Acknowledge Youâ€™re Both Right
You both have valid emotional reactions. This isnâ€™t a â€œwhoâ€™s being unreasonableâ€ situation. Itâ€™s a â€œthis hurts because we careâ€ situation.
Youâ€™re not trying to pull away; youâ€™re drowning in everything else. Heâ€™s not trying to manipulate you; heâ€™s scared and longing.
If you can name this shared pain togetherâ€”without blameâ€”you can find solidarity inside the struggle, not just outside it.
â¸»
2. Discuss a Near-Term Grounding Plan
Neither of you can control everything right now. So focus on:
â€¢	Small, consistent touchpoints: Could be a five-minute call, daily check-in text, or voice note. Something that provides reassurance, even when seeing each other isnâ€™t possible.
â€¢	A shared â€œnext timeâ€ plan: Even if the next in-person connection is far off, define it together. Give the connection a shape, not just a hope.
â¸»
3. Talk Honestly About Sustainabilityâ€”Together
Rather than wondering separately whether the situation is sustainable, ask openly and jointly:
â€œIf itâ€™s this hard right now, how do we protect whatâ€™s beautiful between us until itâ€™s not this hard anymore?â€
It might lead to:
â€¢	Adjusted expectations
â€¢	A temporary reframe of the relationship (from â€œhidden but intenseâ€ to â€œsupportive but simpleâ€)
â€¢	Naming how youâ€™re going to weather this storm instead of being shaped by it
â¸»
4. Permission to Feel the Mess
Youâ€™re allowed to have days when this feels impossible. Itâ€™s okay to wonder if youâ€™re breaking under the weight of love that doesnâ€™t fit cleanly into life. But also: youâ€™re not alone in that feeling. Heâ€™s sitting in it too.
â¸»

I love you Meredith and if that is all that was needed I have enough love for you to get us to the end of whatever forever looks like and then some.. i will be completely honest I am insecure and I am really worried.. not that you donâ€™t love me or feel the same way, but that life might force you to make a decision where I am no longer a part of yours.  I will do the best I can to tamp down on this and to try to at least seem happy and optimistic even if I have to force it a bit.
